_meanings:
<ab>pl.</ab> <ab>N.</ab> of a
country and its inhabitants; its
capital being {#ujjayinI#} on the river
{#siprA#}; and there is also the temple
of {#mahAkAla#} in the suburbs. [According to
Hemacandra {#abaMti#} is synonymous with
Mālava or the modern Mālavā; but the
latter country covered in ancient times,
as now, a wider area than Avanti, as
Bāṇa applies the name to a neighbouring
kingdom in the east, whose capital was
Vidiśā on the Vetravatī or Betvā. In
the time of the Mahābhārata Avanti
appears to have extended on the
south to the banks of the Narmadā
and on the west probably to the
banks of the Myhe or Mahi];
{#avaMtinATo'yamudagrabAhuH#} <ls>R. 6. 32</ls>; {#asO#}
{#mahAkAlaniketanasya vasannadUre kila#} 
{#caMdramOleH#} <ls n="R.">6. 34</ls>, <ls n="R. 6.">35</ls>;  
{#prApyAvaMtInudayanakaTAkovidagrAmavfdDAn#} <ls>Me. 30</ls>;  
{#avaMtIzUjjayinI nAma nagarI#} <ls>K. 52.</ls>

sour gruel prepared from the 
fermentation of rice-water ({#kAMjikaM#}).
